intro: Ione arunachalense, commonly known as the Arunachal Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and high altitudes. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
